titleStmt.title: W. B. Hoke to Daniel C. Wickliffe
CWG7865

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1862-1863

body.p:
Louisville Ky Jan 21st 1863
D. C. Wickliff Esq
Dear Sir
I wish the appointment of Notary Public for the County of Jefferson and hope that you will attend to the matter --

I am not certain about the amount of fee necessary to be forwarded in such cases, but I think One dollar is the sum. I enclose you one dollar, and if this is not sufficient, please inform me immediately -- I wish the appointment in order to swear our clients -- save trouble. Please have the appointment confirmed by the Senate --

Respectfully I remain your
Obedient Servant
W B Hoke
firm of English & Hoke
